English: to offend, outrage, hurt, wrong, injure
to lower, strike (boat), to flood, be flooded
to oppose, thwart, run counter to
to create, nurse, raise, rear, breed
to hiss, sizzle, chirp, screech, squeak
to mislead, lead astray, to go wrong
to mistrust, distrust, lack confidence in
to deviate, deflect, swerve, turn away
to cool, make cool, get chilled
to answer for, bail, entrust, confide
to depict (history), write down a history
to tie, bind, tie up, wrap up
to repatriate, return to one's country
